column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Kau (Fiji): We would like to thank you,\r
#Text=Mr.
#Text=President, for having organized today's debate on\r
#Text=this issue.
#Text=We also congratulate the Secretary-General\r
#Text=for his timely report on the follow-up to the full\r
#Text=implementation of resolution 1325 (2000) on women\r
#Text=and peace and security (S/2004/814).
#Text=While the Secretary-General's report shows that\r
#Text=there have been positive developments in the\r
#Text=implementation of the resolution, further concerted\r
#Text=efforts are needed to ensure that the issue of\r
#Text=implementation is fully addressed.
#Text=The full\r
#Text=implementation of the resolution will continue to be a\r
#Text=challenge for the Security Council and for the United\r
#Text=Nations.
#Text=Fiji attaches great importance to this subject, and\r
#Text=we commend the efforts made thus far by the Security\r
#Text=Council, the General Assembly, the Economic and\r
#Text=Social Council and its functional commissions and\r
#Text=other United Nations bodies and entities.
#Text=We\r
#Text=commend, in particular, the efforts made by the United\r
#Text=Nations Development Fund for Women (UNIFEM) and\r
#Text=by regional organizations and other bodies, including\r
#Text=the Commonwealth Secretariat, which have been active\r
#Text=partners in following up this issue in Fiji.
#Text=Our Ministry\r
#Text=for Women, Social Welfare and Poverty Alleviation has\r
#Text=been the focal point of efforts to mainstream gender\r
#Text=perspectives in relation to critical peace and security\r
#Text=components in Government and other areas.
#Text=The necessary groundwork for the launching in\r
#Text=Fiji of national policies and strategies pursuant to\r
#Text=resolution 1325 (2000) has been greatly boosted by the\r
#Text=sponsorship and support of UNIFEM. and other actors,\r
#Text=including civil society.
#Text=Work on mainstreaming gender\r
#Text=perspectives in relation to conflict prevention,\r
#Text=peacekeeping operations, humanitarian assistance and\r
#Text=post-conflict reconstruction and reconciliation is in\r
#Text=progress.
#Text=Recent political and internal upheavals in our\r
#Text=country have brought out the best in our women, and\r
#Text=their contribution has been a strong factor for good and\r
#Text=steady progress.
#Text=They have been effective stabilizers\r
#Text=and mediators in conflict prevention and very active\r
#Text=players in recent efforts in post-conflict peace-building\r
#Text=and reconciliation processes.
#Text=A week-long peace and\r
#Text=reconciliation process with the objective, inter alia, of\r
#Text=uniting our polarized and divided country, which was\r
#Text=held last month, saw women and children playing key\r
#Text=roles.
#Text=This was preceded by a national workshop on\r
#Text=conflict prevention and early warning.
#Text=In peacekeeping, Fiji, which is a staunch\r
#Text=supporter of and consistent contributor to international\r
#Text=peacekeeping missions, has introduced specific\r
#Text=measures to ensure the expansion of women's role in\r
#Text=peacekeeping.
#Text=Despite the difficulties in overcoming\r
#Text=cultural and traditional barriers, recent deployments\r
#Text=have seen the successful integration of women into\r
#Text=various specialized duties, including guard duty.
#Text=The\r
#Text=military and police departments, together with other\r
#Text=relevant bodies, are working on coherent strategies for\r
#Text=gender mainstreaming in peacekeeping.
#Text=The Fiji\r
#Text=peacekeeping deployment to Iraq will include six\r
#Text=women who have been given specific training in\r
#Text=searching and in counselling.
#Text=That also illustrates our\r
#Text=view that women can be as good as men in all areas if\r
#Text=given the opportunity.
#Text=We fully agree with the Secretary-General that\r
#Text=more effort must be put into capacity-building and\r
#Text=training.
#Text=Gender mainstreaming in relation to all facets\r
#Text=of peace and security requires knowledge and\r
#Text=information-sharing.
#Text=Training and capacity-building\r
#Text=must target not only girls and women, but also boys\r
#Text=and men at all levels of government and the\r
#Text=community.
#Text=It should be all-encompassing and\r
#Text=comprehensive, targeting both the formal and the non-\r
#Text=formal sectors.
#Text=Its inclusion in the education\r
#Text=curriculum will ensure early intervention and sustained\r
#Text=impact.
#Text=The Government, through the programmes of\r
#Text=its Ministry for Women and through the UNIFEM-\r
#Text=sponsored Women and Peace and Security Committee,\r
#Text=is addressing the issue with all relevant stakeholders.
#Text=In addition, there is a need for more effective\r
#Text=coordination and partnerships.
#Text=There is certainly no\r
#Text=lack of will and enthusiasm at the national level,\r
#Text=particularly in developing countries, but enhanced\r
#Text=cooperation and partnership are vital to ensure the\r
#Text=inflow of the resources and expertise which are\r
#Text=generally lacking in our countries.
#Text=We therefore\r
#Text=welcome the call by the Secretary-General for the\r
#Text=development and strengthening of cooperation and\r
#Text=effective partnerships at all levels.
#Text=We acknowledge the\r
#Text=good work done by UNIFEM. and other United Nations\r
#Text=bodies, together with regional organizations such as the\r
#Text=Pacific Islands Forum and the Commonwealth\r
#Text=Secretariat, in the Pacific region, including in Fiji.
#Text=We\r
#Text=can only hope for more such cooperation and\r
#Text=partnerships.
#Text=We also commend the Secretary-General for his\r
#Text=recognition of the role of indigenous women in conflict\r
#Text=resolution as mediators and peace-builders.
#Text=Indigenous\r
#Text=and local women have a strong advocacy role, and it\r
#Text=should be utilized in all aspects of security and peace.
#Text=There is a need to ensure that national and\r
#Text=international efforts for the implementation of\r
#Text=resolution 1325 (2000) are undertaken in a\r
#Text=comprehensive manner in the context of the\r
#Text=Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of\r
#Text=Discrimination against Women and the Beijing\r
#Text=Declaration and Platform for Action.
#Text=To ensure\r
#Text=complementarity and proper coordination, every effort\r
#Text=must be undertaken in collaboration with, and within,\r
#Text=existing institutional arrangements.
#Text=Fiji has a total population of approximately\r
#Text=800,000, with women making up almost half of that\r
#Text=number.
#Text=Given our small population, it was easy for us\r
#Text=to recognize the great potential that women represent.
#Text=In order to make progress, we had to harness all the\r
#Text=resources at our disposal, and women have played the\r
#Text=prominent role we expected - and more - in the\r
#Text=measured forward momentum towards our\r
#Text=developmental goals.
#Text=Our support for the efforts of the\r
#Text=Security Council and the Secretary-General in the\r
#Text=furtherance of women's participation in peace and\r
#Text=security is therefore absolute.
